result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
W/H Sentence - 2 years probation. CONDITIONS: SAFE program or an equvilent program, AODA and follow up, Counseling as recommeded by agent, In 15CM88-Restitution of $193 in to be paid at $20/month until paid in full, Full time work/Full time school and at any point not engaged must complete 10 hours Community Service, Court Costs on all cases, including 1 DV Surcharge, 1 DNA Surcharge and remits all other DNA Surcharges. No objection to being transfered to Outagaime County. 
Adjourned: 2:59 pm
